definition: lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
alone/independent/single/sole/only
tree/CL:棵[ke1]/to cultivate/to set up
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
flag

sentences.english: Our products are unique in style and various in color.
sentences.chinese: 公司产品风格独具，独树一帜，花色品种繁多。

sentences.english: It's no longer a differentiating feature.
sentences.chinese: 这不再是独树一帜的特征。

sentences.english: Dai Zhen was a unique scholar during the Qian- Jia time, who was expert at textual research and argumentation.
sentences.chinese: 戴震兼擅义理与考据，在乾嘉学术史上独树一帜。

sentences.english: Her poetic interpretation of life and ontology of being is her greatest contribution to the modern prose.
sentences.chinese: 张晓风以其独特的诗性解释散文在台湾文坛独树一帜。

sentences.english: Moreover, the economic thoughts of Guanzi make this collection unique among all classical Chinese documents.
sentences.chinese: 《管子》的经济思想又使得它在古代典籍中独树一帜。

sentences.english: Tasty as are, figs stand on their own.
sentences.chinese: 正如无花果陷儿饼干的味道，无花果是很独树一帜的。

sentences.english: Its art style is unique in the folk arts.
sentences.chinese: 它的艺术风格，在民族艺苑里也是独树一帜。

sentences.english: Its art style is unique in the national arts.
sentences.chinese: 它的艺术风格，在民族艺苑里也是独树一帜。

sentences.english: Fully reflects the art of pyrography unique charm.
sentences.chinese: 充分体现烙画独树一帜的艺术魅力。

sentences.english: Shanghai copper decorative pieces of art at home in the unique architectural features.
sentences.chinese: 上海铜艺装饰件，在国内建筑装饰中独树一帜。

sentences.english: Pyramid phototherapy its unique roof, you feel brand new.
sentences.chinese: 其金字塔彩光屋顶独树一帜，给您全新的感受。

sentences.english: STE centrifugal compressor for dry chlorine gas is a unique school of his own in the world.
sentences.chinese: STE的大型离心式氯气压缩机在全球独树一帜。

sentences.english: Their acting skills, unique in the opera has a greater impact on community.
sentences.chinese: 他们演技高超，独树一帜，在戏曲界有较大影响。

sentences.english: The western painter's self-portrait establishes a new school in the world art painting world.
sentences.chinese: 西方画家的自画像在世界艺术画坛中独树一帜。

sentences.english: His theory made him quite remarkable in academic field of the entire Qiania Age.
sentences.chinese: 他的学术思想在整个乾嘉学术时代独树一帜。

definition: lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to have unique (talent, insight etc)
having a unique or distinctive style
most outstanding/par excellence
unique/distinct/having special characteristics
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
characteristic/distinguishing feature or quality
to have a style of one's own
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to be renowned
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
individuality/clear-cut personality
to blaze a new trail (idiom); to display originality
rather/quite/to have much
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
